Игра десятилетия...Потрясающая графика...Шикарный геймплей...Вдохновляющая музыка...и Мурашки по телу и Слёзы на глазах...Half-Life покорила миллионов игроков всего мира...всего человечества...и покорила их сердца...она, как Муза для писателя...как Арфа для музыканта...всегда приятна и мила...Я горжусь этой замечательной игрой...горжусь создателями этой игры...мои любимые Valve... дорогой Гейб Нюэлл...Спасибо Вам за всё...Вы дали нам возможность задуматься над тем, что нас озадачивала жизнь...и в итоге Мы нашли Ответ...именно в этой игре...Не бросай никого в беде...Помогай ближнему своему...люби того, кого требует любить твоё сердце...и кого ты должен знать всегда и везде...Ты всегда с нами Half-Life...мы тебя никуда не пустим, будем тебя оберегать и хранить, пока наши внуки будут расти...и потом они начнут вступаться за тебя горой...мы ждём ещё одного малыша...который прольёт на свет божий ещё одно Великое творение компании Valve...Half-Life 3...И я..от всех Фанатов Half-Life хочу выразить этой игре ОСОБУЮ и ВЕЛИЧЕСТВЕННУЮ Благодарность за всё, что она нам подарила! Спасибо.

It's amazing how this game is great. The graphics are top of the line (for the time) and the sound is very good too. Sometimes a great battle is starting and some techno tunes start to play helping you to get in the mood. 
The characters are appealing. You really start caring about Alyx, the crazy doc, Barney and your war mates. There are no actual bosses, but the challenges keep increasing and the monsters keep coming as good surprises, like the building-tall monsters or even the "crazy blades of doom" that the Combine release. When you think you'll get tired of something, the game changes and adds some cool new aspect, scenario or gun. 10/10!
Шикарная классика, без заморочек. Сюжет, геймплей, графоний - все на месте. Разнообразие игрового процесса очень радует, тут тебе и стрельба, и покатушки, и местами хорор. Рекомендую.

游戏2004年发售，但我在2019年才开始玩，这游戏放在现在看，还是个好游戏
（唯一槽点：我基本是不晕3D的,我玩消逝的光芒都不晕,玩这个晕的不行）
游戏没有引导模式,没有新手教程,没有标识告诉你该往哪走,没有地图,新手刚开始出来就差点不知道怎么走,一切都得自己摸索,前面都是未知,虽然游戏主线是线性的,只有一条往前的路,但路的入口出口在哪得自己摸索,
    印象最深的就是在水障碍区, 开着气垫船到处跑,到了一个油桶封路的地方,我以为游戏是告诉你这里气垫船过不去，要弃船了。就开始弃船地奔，一路用双腿跑过去，跑到一个开水闸能射爆直升机的地方，用机枪射爆了第一个，开了水闸往前走，水闸后面，又出来一个直升机，刚开始边跑边躲，发现不行，然后开始往回跑，将直升机引到机枪那继续射爆，后面继续走着，过了一个瘴气小河，刚出门就是一个武装直升机，路的前面是一条开阔的干涸的大运河，我就边在运河上跑边躲飞机，边找各种掩体，结果每次都被射成筛子，最后发现大运河是真的靠腿过不去，才想到这地方需要气垫船，回去找船，回到油桶那才发现其实船能飞冲过去。。。。想想自己之前，一直在用双脚和直升机赛跑，和直升机斗智斗勇，是真的刺激。

I really wish we got the beta idea and whole story instead, i also wish that we could detach the tau cannon. But still this game is amazing. Not as good as the first but still good. They enemy AI felt a little dumb in this one, im glad they didnt throw grenades every 10 seconds but they rarely ever flanked you or hold angles and wait till you peek them like how the ai did in half life 1. Gun play was cool but this game felt more narrative driven then the last entries in the series. Dont get me wrong its a good game, but it has flaws that could have been fixed like ABH, AI, and gun play. I just wish valve stuck with the beta and never left the series in a cliffhanger like that.
Easily my Favourite game of all time, great story, fantastic plot and greatly in depth and highly detailed characters. I would recommend to anyone who enjoys story driven games. 10/10

这游戏就是我童年的回忆，一直都在玩，只是没有入正版，果然引入成就系统以后就很有趣，打起来也有成就感，印象深刻的是第六章：我们不去莱温霍姆  

这关简直是童年噩梦和回忆杀，小时候不敢玩，在我一个叔叔家玩的，当时还买过CD光盘，回到家装上，只能打到第三关，然后就不会了，当时电脑也没法上网，家长害怕沉迷网络，后来有了网这才通的关

这次打折入的，重新玩了一遍发现乐趣不减当年，而且新电脑RTX2080ti 上 运行这个游戏 毫无压力 （有点浪费了）

What if I told you I had a horror game that is just jump scares? Would you go for that? No? Well, I'm not finished. What if I had a first person shooter with terrible shooting? Still no? What about a platformer that's just in first person and you can't see your own feet? Or an action adventure game with long, unskippable cut scenes and no final boss battle? Oh, also, it ends with a cliff hanger. Would you like that? Well apparently if you mix all those things together you get the greatest game of all time. All it's missing is quick time events. 

Of course the only reason I ever bought this game is because I had been told for years how it was one of the greatest games ever made and so when it went on sale I jumped at the chance and I absolutely hated it. Of course I played it all the way through just so no one could accuse me of leaving too soon. I'm sorry, this game might have been something special back in 2004 (the year that San Andreas, Star Wars Battlefront, and Halo 2 came out) but it definitely doesn't hold up now. 

First of all, the parts I liked about it were the road trip sections. You ride either a small water craft or ATV across a dangerous wasteland and stop to pick up supplies as you please. Meanwhile, innumerable aliens and soldiers await around every corner. There are few, if any, cut scenes and most of the physics puzzles that take advantage of the then impressive and innovative physics engines occur in these sections. However, these sections only take up about 1/3rd of the game.

Also, the gravity gun, a device that pulls objects within a certain range toward you and shoots them forcefully away or gently piles them on top of other objects, was fairly interesting and cathartic, especially when you upgrade it toward the end of the game and use it to lay waste to all things before you. 

Out of everything HL2 pretends to be, foremost is perhaps a first person shooter. However, this might be one of the most generic shooters I've ever played. For supposedly being a futuristic game, all of the guns are shockingly bog-standard, outside of a plasma rifle that has the special ability of shooting a slow energy ball that bounces around a bit and is easily dodged by enemies. Also, the guns are incredibly boring to shoot, except for maybe the magnum revolver, and I might just be being generous. They all sound and kick like pellet guns, even the shotgun. One unique weapon is a gland you can throw like a grenade that commands giant bugs to kill your enemies. This was my favorite weapon because the bugs would kill everything and I wouldn't have to do anything. That's when I realized that I hated the shooting so much that I opted for the weapon that let me avoid doing it. 

Also, the enemy variety is garbage. For the most part, you fight annoying little drones, soldiers, jumping bugs, and zombies oh boy how original are we? I'll talk about about the jumping bugs when I gripe about the horror aspects but right now I want to harp on how boring it is to shoot dozens and dozens and dozens of generic soldiers. The only variety comes when they change the color of their armor, and that just means that they have more health and deal more damage. Color me thrilled. There's little or no strategy involved, mostly because 90% of all combat happens in stifling corridors. So, either they run right out and charge you or they take potshots at you from cover you can't see, often while those intolerable drones swarm you like mosquitos. It's so frustrating. Half the time soldiers jump out at you like jack in the boxes with no chance for you to prepare, making those levels feel like the longest rail shooter. The other half of the time the game will pelt you with endless enemies without distinguishing which circumstance you're in, and you don't realize it until you've run out of ammo and died a thousand times that you're expected to keep moving or shoot a giant robot. Really, the combat feels like a chore. 

Now let's talk level design. It's just the worst. There's something so deliberate, generic, and clinical about the production design that makes everything feel unreal and keeps the atmosphere from ever sinking in. Furthermore, the levels themselves are either cramped, linear corridors that shepherd you forward like livestock or they're obtuse open spaces with no clue as to where you're supposed to go next. Dozens of times I ended up backtracking for minutes to see if I missed a ladder or a door, only to find that what I thought was a corner of a room actually opened into yet another corridor that blended into the endless concrete walls, or what I thought was a pile of debris was actually a hole in the ground. Sometimes, the way forward is opened by a scripted event, like an explosion indistinguishable from the thousands of other explosions you've heard throughout the game, but if you happen to be hiding in cover like a sane person you'll miss the scripted  event. The worst part of these levels is that each and every one is too long. Even the levels I liked wore out their welcome by the time I finished them. Too much padding and filler of endless grey halls and piles of meticulously stacked garbage.

The most frustrating part of the level design for me is the inclusion of a ridiculous amount of required precision platforming sections. First of all, it's a first person game. Secondly, you can't see your feet so there's often no telling if you'll make the jump or not. Lastly, your character bounces violently off of walls, slides an extra six inches forwards upon landing, or gets caught up on one or two pixels of texture that kill your jump altogether. Essentially, the platforming is garbage but there's no avoiding it.

The game also has a few oddly placed horror elements. There is a spider like bug that jumps out at you and creates zombies, some of which run and some of which throw other bugs at you. I won't lie, at first these bugs really make your skin crawl, especially when they hide and wait in dark corners, requiring you to use your flashlight (whose power for some reason is also tied to your sprint meter). However, they really lose their edge after the hundredth time they jump out at you. Furthermore, after the designated haunted sawmill town level they continue to show up in random places, raising my blood pressure in irritation every single time. There are also larger jumping bugs that appear when you move on sand, which you can eventually turn to your side. Not scary, but keeps you moving along at a good pace until you aren't sure where you're supposed to go next. Lastly, there are these long tongues descending from the ceiling that slowly lift you up and eat you. They are just there to annoy you and thankfully are gone after the first half of the game. 

Lastly, the story is fine. It's about starting a resistance against the most boring dictatorship of all time. The problem is that there are only two likeable characters in the entire game: The one legged scientist man you see three times and the midwestern resistance fighter  who shows up for one level. Your love interest is annoying and sans any chemistry, the main villain reminds me of a high school principal, and the only other characters are resistance allies that only serve to run out and get killed immediately or get in my way when I'm shooting the rocket launcher, killing us both. The main problem with the writing is that the story is told in extremely long expository conversations that technically aren't cut scenes but can't be ended early and can't be bypassed and are thus essentially cut scenes.

All in all, a frustrating game that isn't worth the time required to play it. Don't hold your breath for Half Life 3.

Из плюсов:
- Несколько атмосферных локаций.
- Наполненные уровни (Хотя и линейные)
- Физика (Буквально каждый предмет имеет довольно реалистичную физику)
- Графика
Дальше минусы:
- Слабый ИИ
- Посредственный сюжет
- Тир (Даже хороший дизайн локаций на спасает)
- Босс вертолёт (И даже не один)

Игра не просто так считается легендой. Поиграть мне удалось пока, что только во вторую часть, и жаль что так поздно. Первая часть Half-life, в свое время навела не мало шуму и была на слуху у геймеров того времени и остаётся до сих пор. Трудно найти человека, который интересуется играми и незнает про half-life. Я очень рад что прошел эту игру. Она оставила мне много хороших воспоминаний. Сюжет немного переоценен. Но главной фишкой, я считаю геймплей. Он действительно радует. Очень приятно находится в игре, ходить, стрелять. Позже куплю 1 часть, а после и эпизоды. Чтобы полностью погрузиться в этот замечательный мир.

Do you need fans?  Now, you have them, but soon they may not become.  Because people are not eternal.  Do you need tears?  Well, you got your way.
